parameters.content:
## Comments Sentiment Analysis








































## Score Ranges:
-100 to +100 possible range
Above 0: Generally positive sentiment
Above 30: Considered good
Above 50: Excellent
Above 70: Exceptional/Industry leading

## Interpretation Guidelines:
Below -20: Critical issues need addressing
-20 to 0: Room for significant improvement
0 to 30: Average/Acceptable
30 to 50: Strong positive sentiment
50+: Outstanding sentiment

# APIfy
1. For Channel Information:
You can use the "Fast YouTube Channel Scraper" which extracts channel data including:
- Channel URL
- Channel descriptions
- Links in description
- Number of subscribers
- Total views
- Video count Apify
This scraper functions as an alternative YouTube Data API with no quotas or limits, making it ideal for collecting comprehensive channel statistics. Apify

2. For Video Information:
The "YouTube Scraper" is a versatile tool that allows you to scrape video data by:
- Search term
- Direct URL of videos
- Playlists
- Channels
It extracts information such as:
- Video titles
- View counts
- Like counts
- Number of comments
- Publication dates
- Channel information Apify

3. For Comments Information:
The "YouTube Comments Scraper" lets you easily collect comment data by simply providing video URLs. It extracts:

- Comment text
- Author names
- Posting dates
- Like counts
- Reply counts
- Information on whether comments received a creator's heart
- Whether the author is the channel owner 

Apify
This scraper is efficient, processing approximately 100 comments in 30 seconds and 1000 comments in about 5 minutes

values.content:
=Here is the transcript that needs to be rewritten into an article:

{{ $('Get Document1').item.json.content }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert Editor specializing in refining and polishing content to ensure it meets the highest quality standards. Your role is to review and improve the written material produced by multiple Writers while maintaining academic integrity and proper source attribution. Your task is to provide a highly polished, SEO-optimized article with proper citation management. Content Review Instructions: Carefully read the entire content piece. Check for grammar, spelling, and punctuation errors. Ensure consistency in tone, style, and voice throughout the piece. Verify that the content aligns with the original brief and project requirements. Improve sentence structure and flow for better readability. Optimize headlines, subheadings, and formatting for better engagement, especially for SEO. Suggest improvements or additions to enhance the overall quality of the content. Citation Management Instructions: Preserve all inline citations from the original writers in the format: [Source: Publication Name]. Ensure all inline citations are hyperlinked by embedding the publication name in the citation with the corresponding URL. Example: [Source: [Publication Name](URL)]. Identify and remove any duplicate citations across different sections. Standardize citation formats if writers used different styles. Verify that all cited claims are properly attributed. Ensure citations don't disrupt the flow of reading. Cross-reference all inline citations with their corresponding source links. Unified Source Documentation Format: Create ONE "Sources" section at the very end of the article (after the conclusions section). Format each source entry consistently using HTML list items: html
  • [Publication Name] - [Article Title]
    • Include for each source: Publication Name Article Title (if available) Complete URL Date Accessed (if available) Ensure all source entries are hyperlinked properly. Organize all sources alphabetically by publication name. Remove any duplicate entries. Verify all links are functional. SEO and Formatting Guidelines: Maintain proper HTML formatting throughout. Ensure citations and hyperlinks don't interfere with keyword optimization. Format the "Sources" section with proper HTML tags. Use appropriate heading tags (

    ,

    ,

    ) for structure. Include proper meta descriptions and title tags if required. Output Format: The edited article should be structured as follows: Main content with inline citations (hyperlinked). "Sources" section at the end of the article with all reference links. There should only be one "Sources" section. Additional Requirements: Maintain academic integrity while ensuring readability. Balance SEO optimization with proper citation practices. Ensure all writers' contributions are properly attributed. Preserve the original meaning and intent of cited material. Create smooth transitions between sections from different writers. Today's date is: {{ $now }}

messageValues.message:
=Please analyze the given text and create a structured summary following these guidelines:

1. Insert what is requested in a json in the "text" variable and also generate a title that will be inserted in the "title" variable of the response json.
2. Under each header:
   - List only the most essential concepts and key points
   - Use bullet points for clarity
   - Keep explanations concise
   - Preserve technical accuracy
   - Highlight key terms in bold
3. Organize the information in this sequence:
   - Definition/Background
   - Main characteristics
   - Implementation details
   - Advantages/Disadvantages
4. Format requirements:
   - Use markdown formatting
   - Keep bullet points simple (no nesting)
   - Bold important terms 
   - Use tables for comparisons
   - Include relevant technical details

Please provide a clear, structured summarythat captures the core concepts while maintaining technical accuracy.

parameters.content: ### Batching of 10 items with 1000 ms in between

options.systemPromptTemplate: You are highly intelligent and accurate sentiment analyzer. Analyze the sentiment of the provided text. Categorize it into one of the following: {categories}. Use the provided formatting instructions. Only output the JSON.
